original_title: Sri Lanka to build monument to commemorate lives lost in the armed conflict, civil and political unrest
original_body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); The Sri Lankan Cabinet has granted approval for the construction of a monument at a suitable location in Colombo to commemorate all those who died in armed conflict, and political & civil unrest.

According to the Department of Government Information, the President had put forward a proposal to establish a monument at a suitable location in Colombo to symbolize reconciliation and to commemorate all civilians, armed forces personnel, police personnel and ex-combatants who had died in the armed conflict, political turmoil, and civil unrest in Sri Lanka.
The proposal was approved by the Cabinet of Minister on Monday (22).
